alert.note: Alert for Central Somerset; Northern Franklin (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 04 at 7:44AM EST until March 04 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT SNOWSTORM THROUGH TODAY... .A winter storm tracking offshore of southern New England today will bring a period of locally heavy snowfall rates to south-central New Hampshire and southwestern Maine through this morning. Snowfall rates will then temporarily decrease late this morning before increasing again for a few hours this afternoon as low pressure strengthens offshore. Wet snow may also fall along the coasts of Maine and New Hampshire. Additionally, strong gusty winds along the coastal plain and into the interior are expected. When combined with wet snow, this may lead to power outages and when combined with drier snow, would produce localized whiteout conditions. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations up to 5 inches for a storm total of 1 to 9 inches. * WHERE...Central Somerset and Northern Franklin Counties. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...A weather system will bring a period of snowfall to the region. Although snowfall amounts will be light to moderate, travel will still be impacted due to snowfall accumulations on roads.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
